text: they came in their thousands streaming
across the border desperate to buy basic
food and medicine in the 12 hours they
were given for many suffering under the
weight of Venezuela's food shortages it
was a lifeline no Cabrera nor Asuka I
came here to buy rice sugar milk
medicine anything else we can get
because we already don't have anything
to eat the starving was o'leary abroad
zombies they gave us a free pass through
the border and we're taking advantage of
it thank God because the situation is
critical people from all over came today
since oil prices plummeted Venezuela
which exports little else has found
itself with a huge hole in its budget
and has been unable to feed its people
queuing often for hours is the norm only
to find that there is little available
to buy when they reach the top of the
line this border opening comes days
after hundreds of Venezuelan women
frustrated by the dire situation work
through controls in search of food many
others have been crossing over illegally
as well Venezuelans normally need
special permits to enter Colombia a
measure introduced to clamp down on
cross-border crime but with the
situation so critical there are now
plans to try and permanently open the
borders offering some lasting reprieve
in this deep crisis regin armored BBC
news
